title.narrative: Sustainable Dairy Farming and Milk Safety Project

description.narrative: The project will support the $160 million investment plan of Inner Mongolia Saikexing Breeding and Biotechnology Group (SKX), the fourth largest dairy farming company in the People's Republic of China (PRC), over the 2017-2018 period, including: (i) environmental capex, (ii) food safety capex, and (iii) modern dairy farm expansion capex. As such, the project will promote modern dairy farming with better environmental sustainability and product safety.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Modern dairy farming with stronger environmental sustainability and milk safety demonstrated

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
b. CO2 emissions avoided from methane capture in biogas digesters reached 66,000 tons per year (2015 baseline: 0)

description.narrative: Modern dairy farming with stronger environmental sustainability and milk safety demonstrated

title.narrative: d. Percentage of wastewater diluted before being used for irrigation decreases to 10% (2015 baseline: 100%)b

description.narrative: Modern dairy farming with stronger environmental sustainability and milk safety demonstrated

title.narrative: c. BOD5 and COD levels in discharged wastewater decrease to 50 mg/l and 250 mg/l, respectively (2015 baseline: 150 mg/l and 400 mg/l, respectively)b

description.narrative: Modern dairy farming with stronger environmental sustainability and milk safety demonstrated

title.narrative: h. Number of smallholder farmers supplying forage to SKX increases to 17,500 (2015 baseline: 15,000)

description.narrative: Modern dairy farming with stronger environmental sustainability and milk safety demonstrated

title.narrative: a. Annual production of organic fertilizer increases to 210,000 tons (2015 baseline: 150,000 tons)

description.narrative: Modern dairy farming with stronger environmental sustainability and milk safety demonstrated

title.narrative: g. Number of workers employed by the dairy farms increases to 2,600, of whom 35% are women (2015 baseline: 2,000, of whom 31% are women)

description.narrative: Modern dairy farming with stronger environmental sustainability and milk safety demonstrated

title.narrative: e. Maximum number of microorganisms in raw milk decreases to 50,000 CFU per ml (2015 baseline: 200,000 CFU per ml)c

description.narrative: Modern dairy farming with stronger environmental sustainability and milk safety demonstrated

title.narrative: f. Maximum number of somatic cells in raw milk decreases to 250,000 per ml (2015 baseline: 600,000 per ml)d

description.narrative: Modern dairy farming with stronger environmental sustainability and milk safety demonstrated
